tool_description: An AI service from Microsoft Azure that analyzes content in images
name: Microsoft Computer Vision
title: Microsoft Computer Vision

api_list.name: List Models
api_list.description: This operation returns the list of domain-specific models that are supported by the Computer Vision API. Currently, the API supports following domain-specific models: celebrity recognizer, landmark recognizer.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com/models"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com/models"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

schema.description: Result of the List Domain Models operation.

items.description: An object describing supported model by name and categories.

api_list.name: Analyze Image
api_list.description:
This operation extracts a rich set of visual features based on the image content.
Two input methods are supported -- (1) Uploading an image or (2) specifying an image URL. Within your request, there is an optional parameter to allow you to choose which features to return. By default, image categories are returned in the response.
A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en". Supported languages:
**en** - English, Default. 
**es** - Spanish,
 **ja** - Japanese, 
**pt** - Portuguese,
 **zh** - Simplified Chinese.

optional_parameters.name: descriptionExclude
optional_parameters.description: Turn off specified domain models when generating the description.

optional_parameters.name: visualFeatures
optional_parameters.description:
A string indicating what visual feature types to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: 

**Categories** - categorizes image content according to a taxonomy defined in documentation. 
**Tags** - tags the image with a detailed list of words related to the image content. 
**Description** - describes the image content with a complete English sentence. 
**Faces** - detects if faces are present. If present, generate coordinates, gender and age. **ImageType** - detects if image is clipart or a line drawing. 
**Color** - determines the accent color, dominant color, and whether an image is black&white. 
**Adult** - detects if the image is pornographic in nature (depicts nudity or a sex act), or is gory (depicts extreme violence or blood). Sexually suggestive content (aka racy content) is also detected. 
**Objects** - detects various objects within an image, including the approximate location. The Objects argument is only available in English. 
**Brands** - detects various brands within an image, including the approximate location. The Brands argument is only available in English.

optional_parameters.name: details
optional_parameters.description:
A string indicating which domain-specific details to return. Multiple values should be comma-separated. Valid visual feature types include: 

**Celebrities** - identifies celebrities if detected in the image, 
**Landmarks** - identifies notable landmarks in the image.

adult.description: An object describing whether the image contains adult-oriented content and/or is racy.

adultScore.description: Score from 0 to 1 that indicates how much the content is considered adult-oriented within the image.

goreScore.description: Score from 0 to 1 that indicates how gory is the image.

isAdultContent.description: A value indicating if the image contains adult-oriented content.

isGoryContent.description: A value indicating if the image is gory.

isRacyContent.description: A value indicating if the image is racy.

racyScore.description: Score from 0 to 1 that indicates how suggestive is the image.

brands.description: Array of brands detected in the image.

items.description: A brand detected in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the brand in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

detail.description: An object describing additional category details.

celebrities.description: An array of celebrities if any identified.

items.description: An object describing possible celebrity identification.

confidence.description: Confidence level for the celebrity recognition as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

height.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the face, in pixels.

left.description: X-coordinate of the top left point of the face, in pixels.

top.description: Y-coordinate of the top left point of the face, in pixels.

width.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the face, in pixels.

landmarks.description: An array of landmarks if any identified.

items.description: A landmark recognized in the image.

confidence.description: Confidence level for the landmark recognition as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

color.description: An object providing additional metadata describing color attributes.

dominantColors.description: An array of possible dominant colors.

isBWImg.description: A value indicating if the image is black and white.

description.description: A collection of content tags, along with a list of captions sorted by confidence level, and image metadata.

captions.description: A list of captions, sorted by confidence level.

items.description: An image caption, i.e. a brief description of what the image depicts.

confidence.description: The level of confidence the service has in the caption.

faces.description: An array of possible faces within the image.

items.description: An object describing a face identified in the image.

imageType.description: An object providing possible image types and matching confidence levels.

clipArtType.description: Confidence level that the image is a clip art.

lineDrawingType.description: Confidence level that the image is a line drawing.

objects.description: Array of objects describing what was detected in the image.

items.description: An object detected in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the object in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

parent.description: An object detected inside an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the object in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

rectangle.description: A bounding box for an area inside an image.

h.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

w.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

x.description: X-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

tags.description: A list of tags with confidence level.

items.description: An entity observation in the image, along with the confidence score.

confidence.description: The level of confidence that the entity was observed.

api_list.name: Describe Image
api_list.description:
This operation generates a description of an image in human readable language with complete sentences. The description is based on a collection of content tags, which are also returned by the operation. More than one description can be generated for each image. Descriptions are ordered by their confidence score. Descriptions may include results from celebrity and landmark domain models, if applicable.

A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.

optional_parameters.name: maxCandidates
optional_parameters.description: Maximum number of candidate descriptions to be returned.  The default is 1.

optional_parameters.name: descriptionExclude
optional_parameters.description: Turn off specified domain models when generating the description.

schema.description: A collection of content tags, along with a list of captions sorted by confidence level, and image metadata.

description.description: A collection of content tags, along with a list of captions sorted by confidence level, and image metadata.

captions.description: A list of captions, sorted by confidence level.

items.description: An image caption, i.e. a brief description of what the image depicts.

confidence.description: The level of confidence the service has in the caption.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

api_list.name: Tag Image
api_list.description:
This operation generates a list of words, or tags, that are relevant to the content of the supplied image. The Computer Vision API can return tags based on objects, living beings, scenery or actions found in images. Unlike categories, tags are not organized according to a hierarchical classification system, but correspond to image content. Tags may contain hints to avoid ambiguity or provide context, for example the tag "ascomycete" may be accompanied by the hint "fungus".

A successful response will be returned in JSON. If the request failed, the response will contain an error code and a message to help understand what went wrong.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.

schema.description: The results of a image tag operation, including any tags and image metadata.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

tags.description: A list of tags with confidence level.

items.description: An entity observation in the image, along with the confidence score.

confidence.description: The level of confidence that the entity was observed.

api_list.name: Analyze Image By Domain
api_list.description: This operation recognizes content within an image by applying a domain-specific model. The list of domain-specific models that are supported by the Computer Vision API can be retrieved using the /models GET request. Currently, the API provides following domain-specific models: celebrities, landmarks.

required_parameters.name: model
required_parameters.description:
The domain-specific content to recognize.

Allowed values:
**celebrities**
**landmarks**

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: The desired language for output generation. If this parameter is not specified, the default value is "en".Supported languages:en - English, Default. es - Spanish, ja - Japanese, pt - Portuguese, zh - Simplified Chinese.

schema.description: Result of image analysis using a specific domain model including additional metadata.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

api_list.name: Generate Thumbnail
api_list.description: This operation generates a thumbnail image with the user-specified width and height. By default, the service analyzes the image, identifies the region of interest (ROI), and generates smart cropping coordinates based on the ROI. Smart cropping helps when you specify an aspect ratio that differs from that of the input image.

required_parameters.name: width
required_parameters.description: Width of the thumbnail, in pixels. It must be between 1 and 1024. Recommended minimum of 50.

required_parameters.name: height
required_parameters.description: Height of the thumbnail, in pixels. It must be between 1 and 1024. Recommended minimum of 50.

optional_parameters.name: smartCropping
optional_parameters.description: Boolean flag for enabling smart cropping.

api_list.name: Detect Objects
api_list.description: Performs object detection on the specified image.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com/detect"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com/detect"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

items.description: An object detected in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the object in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

parent.description: An object detected inside an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score of having observed the object in the image, as a value ranging from 0 to 1.

rectangle.description: A bounding box for an area inside an image.

h.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

w.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

x.description: X-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

requestId.description: Id of the REST API request.

api_list.name: Recognize Printed Text
api_list.description: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) detects text in an image and extracts the recognized characters into a machine-usable character stream.

required_parameters.name: detectOrientation
required_parameters.description: Whether detect the text orientation in the image. With detectOrientation=true the OCR service tries to detect the image orientation and correct it before further processing (e.g. if it's upside-down).

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: The BCP-47 language code of the text to be detected in the image. The default value is 'unk'.

language.description: The BCP-47 language code of the text in the image.

orientation.description:
Orientation of the text recognized in the image, if requested. The value (up, down, left, or right) refers to the direction that the top of the recognized text is facing, after the image has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property).
If detection of the orientation was not requested, or no text is detected, the value is 'NotDetected'.

regions.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a region of recognized text.

items.description: A region consists of multiple lines (e.g. a column of text in a multi-column document).

boundingBox.description: Bounding box of a recognized region. The four integers represent the x-coordinate of the left edge, the y-coordinate of the top edge, width, and height of the bounding box, in the coordinate system of the input image, after it has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property), with the origin at the top-left corner, and the y-axis pointing down.

lines.description: An array of recognized lines of text.

items.description: An object describing a single recognized line of text.

boundingBox.description: Bounding box of a recognized line. The four integers represent the x-coordinate of the left edge, the y-coordinate of the top edge, width, and height of the bounding box, in the coordinate system of the input image, after it has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property), with the origin at the top-left corner, and the y-axis pointing down.

words.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a recognized word.

boundingBox.description: Bounding box of a recognized word. The four integers represent the x-coordinate of the left edge, the y-coordinate of the top edge, width, and height of the bounding box, in the coordinate system of the input image, after it has been rotated around its center according to the detected text angle (see textAngle property), with the origin at the top-left corner, and the y-axis pointing down.

text.description: String value of a recognized word.

textAngle.description: The angle, in radians, of the detected text with respect to the closest horizontal or vertical direction. After rotating the input image clockwise by this angle, the recognized text lines become horizontal or vertical. In combination with the orientation property it can be used to overlay recognition results correctly on the original image, by rotating either the original image or recognition results by a suitable angle around the center of the original image. If the angle cannot be confidently detected, this property is not present. If the image contains text at different angles, only part of the text will be recognized correctly.

api_list.name: Get Area Of Interest
api_list.description: This operation returns a bounding box around the most important area of the image.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com/areaOfInterest"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-computer-vision3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

areaOfInterest.description: A bounding box for an area inside an image.

h.description: Height measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

w.description: Width measured from the top-left point of the area, in pixels.

x.description: X-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.

y.description: Y-coordinate of the top left point of the area, in pixels.
